result.execSummary:
The defendant Richard Nmi Baez was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manuf/Deliver Schedule I, II Narcotics, a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
If revoked:
Defendant IS eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant IS eligible for Substance Abuse Program.
Apply 4 days credit.
The Conditions for Extended Supervision are the same as the Conditions for Probation.
Court would approve early termination of Probation AFTER 2 years, if all conditions have been met.

miscConds.notes:
DNA surcharge ($250) and court costs ($268) are to be paid as a Condition of Probation.

  If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.
Maintain full-time employment and/or combination of schooling.
AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment/counseling recommended.

ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
Submit to random urine screens.
No use or possession of alcohol, illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.
No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
Provide DNA sample if not yet provided (pay surcharge).
Cash bail to be refunded to poster.

records.addlTxt: requesting to be released from probation, filed by defendant. (copy sent to DA and Probation and Parole)
Filed by the defendant requesting Huber release for Child Care.
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.
Court received information from Wisconsin Community Services regarding defendant's compliance/non-compliance.

Defendant Richard Nmi Baez in court with attorney Joan B Broughton.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Prosecuting attorney moves to strike the repeater from Count 1.  Court grants motion.  Repeater struck from Count 1.    Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count 1.  Court finds defendant guilty.  Count 2 dismissed and read in.

Court orders the following:
- Total sentence: 3 years (Initial Confinement: 1 year 6 months, Extended Supervision: 1 year 6 months) STAYED.  Credit for 4 days if revoked.
- Defendant IS eligible for Challenge Incarceration
- Defendant IS eligible for Substance Abuse Program
- 3 years Probation.  Court would approve early termination of Probation after 2 years if all conditions have been met.
- Cash bail to be refunded to poster.
- Court costs of $268.00 to be paid as a Condition of Probation
- DNA Surcharge of $250.00 to be paid as a Condition of Probation
- Buy money of $440.00 to be paid to Waukesha Police Department as a Condition of Probation
- Conditions of Probation: Submit to an AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment/counseling.  Maintain full-time employment and/or school.  Maintain absolute sobriety/Random UAs.  No use or possession of alcohol/drug paraphernalia/drugs without a valid prescription.  DNA Sample if not yet provided, defendant to pay surcharge.

CONDITION TIME: 3 months - NON WORKING HOURS WITH STANDARD RELEASE CONDITIONS - To commence June 26, 2014 by 6:00 pm.
